column4: is there anyway to install ubuntu inside of windows, like to a diff hd then just reboot, and boot into windows or ubuntu?
debian used to have a utlity called loadlin that would let you install from windows... i'm not sure if ubuntu has it or not.  but even if you boot off the cd, you can definitely dual-boot your box
i disconected my cdrom in order to have more harddrives, i could put it back in just to install ubuntu then take it out, but im lazy so was just wondering if there was a way to do it without a cdrom
ok there is... you'll have to find loadlin.exe if it's not on the cd though
